page.title: 12FARMING IN 1985
page.content: the fields are divided by electric fences (long pieces of wire with electricity pulsed through them). When an animal touches it - it gives them a small harmless shock, and makes it unlikely that the animals would run thorugh the fence. The cows eat lots of grass. The actual cattle types are Fresian and Herefords. The latter are mainly used for breeding, which is done at any time of the year. The cows are milked 2 or 3 times a day in a milking parlour. This is a building with 2 rows of troughs, the cows are sent in to eat the grass nuts inside, while they eat these they are milked by clusters which are 4 pieces of rubber in tubular shapes. Electricity causes suction and makes the clusters cling onto the cow's teats. These then suck the milk out into a tank where it is
